verses.kjv: The word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah concerning the dearth.
verses.web: This is LORD’s word that came to Jeremiah concerning the drought.
verses.ct: This is the word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah about the drought.

verses.kjv: Judah mourneth, and the gates thereof languish; they are black unto the ground; and the cry of Jerusalem is gone up.
verses.web: “Judah mourns, and its gates languish. They sit in black on the ground. The cry of Jerusalem goes up.
verses.ct: Judah is in mourning. Her city gates are lifeless. The people sit on the ground dressed in black, and the cries of Jerusalem rise to the sky.

verses.kjv: And their nobles have sent their little ones to the waters: they came to the pits, and found no water; they returned with their vessels empty; they were ashamed and confounded, and covered their heads.
verses.web: Their nobles send their little ones to the waters. They come to the cisterns, and find no water. They return with their vessels empty. They are disappointed and confounded, and cover their heads.
verses.ct: The nobles send their servants to find water. They go to the cisterns but find them dry. They come back with empty jars, humiliated and devastated, covering their heads in shame.

verses.kjv: Because the ground is chapt, for there was no rain in the earth, the plowmen were ashamed, they covered their heads.
verses.web: Because of the ground which is cracked, because no rain has been in the land, the plowmen are disappointed. They cover their heads.
verses.ct: The ground is cracked because no rain has fallen on the land. The farmers are devastated and cover their heads in despair.

verses.kjv: Yea, the hind also calved in the field, and forsook it, because there was no grass.
verses.web: Yes, the doe in the field also calves and forsakes her young, because there is no grass.
verses.ct: Even the deer gives birth in the open field and abandons her newborn because there is no grass to eat.

verses.kjv: And the wild asses did stand in the high places, they snuffed up the wind like dragons; their eyes did fail, because there was no grass.
verses.web: The wild donkeys stand on the bare heights. They pant for air like jackals. Their eyes fail, because there is no vegetation.
verses.ct: Wild donkeys stand on the barren hilltops, gasping for air like jackals. Their eyes grow dim because there is nothing green left to eat.

verses.kjv: O LORD, though our iniquities testify against us, do thou it for thy name’s sake: for our backslidings are many; we have sinned against thee.
verses.web: Though our iniquities testify against us, work for your name’s sake, LORD; for our rebellions are many. We have sinned against you.
verses.ct: "LORD, even though our sins testify against us, act for the sake of your name. We have rebelled against you again and again — we have sinned against you."

verses.kjv: O the hope of Israel, the saviour thereof in time of trouble, why shouldest thou be as a stranger in the land, and as a wayfaring man that turneth aside to tarry for a night?
verses.web: You hope of Israel, its Savior in the time of trouble, why should you be as a foreigner in the land, and as a wayfaring man who turns aside to stay for a night?
verses.ct: "You are the hope of Israel, the one who saves us in times of trouble. Why do you act like a stranger passing through the land, like a traveler who only stops for one night?"

verses.kjv: Why shouldest thou be as a man astonied, as a mighty man that cannot save? yet thou, O LORD, art in the midst of us, and we are called by thy name; leave us not.
verses.web: Why should you be like a scared man, as a mighty man who can’t save? Yet you, LORD, are in the middle of us, and we are called by your name. Don’t leave us.
verses.ct: "Why do you stand there like someone caught off guard, like a warrior who can't rescue anyone? Yet you are right here among us, LORD, and we carry your name. Don't abandon us."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD unto this people, Thus have they loved to wander, they have not refrained their feet, therefore the LORD doth not accept them; he will now remember their iniquity, and visit their sins.
verses.web: LORD says to this people, “Even so they have loved to wander. They have not restrained their feet. Therefore LORD does not accept them. Now he will remember their iniquity, and punish them for their sins.”
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says about this people: "They love to wander and refuse to hold back their feet. So the LORD does not accept them. Now he will remember their guilt and punish them for their sins."

verses.kjv: Then said the LORD unto me, Pray not for this people for their good.
verses.web: LORD said to me, “Don’t pray for this people for their good.
verses.ct: Then the LORD told me, "Don't pray for the well-being of this people."

verses.kjv: When they fast, I will not hear their cry; and when they offer burnt offering and an oblation, I will not accept them: but I will consume them by the sword, and by the famine, and by the pestilence.
verses.web: When they fast, I will not hear their cry; and when they offer burnt offering and meal offering, I will not accept them; but I will consume them by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence.”
verses.ct: "Even when they fast, I won't listen to their cries. Even when they bring burnt offerings and grain offerings, I won't accept them. Instead, I will destroy them with war, famine, and disease."

verses.kjv: Then said I, Ah, Lord GOD! behold, the prophets say unto them, Ye shall not see the sword, neither shall ye have famine; but I will give you assured peace in this place.
verses.web: Then I said, “Ah, Lord LORD! Behold, the prophets tell them, ‘You will not see the sword, neither will you have famine; but I will give you assured peace in this place.’ ”
verses.ct: Then I said, "Lord GOD! The prophets keep telling the people, 'You won't face war or famine. The LORD will give you lasting peace right here in this land.'"

verses.kjv: Then the LORD said unto me, The prophets prophesy lies in my name: I sent them not, neither have I commanded them, neither spake unto them: they prophesy unto you a false vision and divination, and a thing of nought, and the deceit of their heart.
verses.web: Then LORD said to me, “The prophets prophesy lies in my name. I didn’t send them. I didn’t command them. I didn’t speak to them. They prophesy to you a lying vision, divination, and a thing of nothing, and the deceit of their own heart.
verses.ct: The LORD answered me, "Those prophets are speaking lies in my name. I never sent them. I never gave them orders. I never spoke to them. What they're telling you are false visions, worthless divination, empty nonsense — nothing but the lies their own hearts invented."

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD concerning the prophets that prophesy in my name, and I sent them not, yet they say, Sword and famine shall not be in this land; By sword and famine shall those prophets be consumed.
verses.web: Therefore LORD says concerning the prophets who prophesy in my name, but I didn’t send them, yet they say, ‘Sword and famine will not be in this land.’ Those prophets will be consumed by sword and famine.
verses.ct: "So this is what the LORD says about those prophets who speak in my name even though I never sent them — the ones who say, 'There will be no war or famine in this land': Those very prophets will die by war and famine."

verses.kjv: And the people to whom they prophesy shall be cast out in the streets of Jerusalem because of the famine and the sword; and they shall have none to bury them, them, their wives, nor their sons, nor their daughters: for I will pour their wickedness upon them.
verses.web: The people to whom they prophesy will be cast out in the streets of Jerusalem because of the famine and the sword. They will have no one to bury them—them, their wives, their sons, or their daughters, for I will pour their wickedness on them.
verses.ct: "And the people they prophesied to will be thrown into the streets of Jerusalem, killed by famine and the sword. No one will be left to bury them — not them, not their wives, not their sons, not their daughters. I will pour out on them the punishment their wickedness deserves."

verses.kjv: Therefore thou shalt say this word unto them; Let mine eyes run down with tears night and day, and let them not cease: for the virgin daughter of my people is broken with a great breach, with a very grievous blow.
verses.web: “You shall say this word to them: “ ‘Let my eyes run down with tears night and day, and let them not cease; for the virgin daughter of my people is broken with a great breach, with a very grievous wound.
verses.ct: "Say this to them: 'Let my eyes overflow with tears night and day without stopping, because my dear people — like a young daughter — have been shattered by a devastating blow, a terrible wound."

verses.kjv: If I go forth into the field, then behold the slain with the sword! and if I enter into the city, then behold them that are sick with famine! yea, both the prophet and the priest go about into a land that they know not.
verses.web: If I go out into the field, then, behold, the slain with the sword! If I enter into the city, then, behold, those who are sick with famine! For both the prophet and the priest go about in the land, and have no knowledge.’ ”
verses.ct: "If I go out to the countryside, I see people cut down by the sword. If I walk into the city, I see people wasting away from hunger. Even the prophets and priests wander through a land they no longer recognize.'"

verses.kjv: Hast thou utterly rejected Judah? hath thy soul lothed Zion? why hast thou smitten us, and there is no healing for us? we looked for peace, and there is no good; and for the time of healing, and behold trouble!
verses.web: Have you utterly rejected Judah? Has your soul loathed Zion? Why have you struck us, and there is no healing for us? We looked for peace, but no good came; and for a time of healing, and behold, dismay!
verses.ct: "Have you completely rejected Judah? Does your soul despise Zion? Why have you struck us with wounds that can't be healed? We hoped for peace, but nothing good came. We waited for a time of healing, but all we got was terror."

verses.kjv: We acknowledge, O LORD, our wickedness, and the iniquity of our fathers: for we have sinned against thee.
verses.web: We acknowledge, LORD, our wickedness, and the iniquity of our fathers; for we have sinned against you.
verses.ct: "LORD, we confess our wickedness and the guilt of our ancestors. We have sinned against you."

verses.kjv: Do not abhor us, for thy name’s sake, do not disgrace the throne of thy glory: remember, break not thy covenant with us.
verses.web: Do not abhor us, for your name’s sake. Do not disgrace the throne of your glory. Remember, and don’t break your covenant with us.
verses.ct: "For the sake of your name, don't reject us. Don't bring disgrace on your glorious throne. Remember your covenant with us — don't break it."

verses.kjv: Are there any among the vanities of the Gentiles that can cause rain? or can the heavens give showers? art not thou he, O LORD our God? therefore we will wait upon thee: for thou hast made all these things.
verses.web: Are there any among the vanities of the nations that can cause rain? Or can the sky give showers? Aren’t you he, LORD our God? Therefore we will wait for you; for you have made all these things.
verses.ct: "Can any of the worthless idols of the nations bring rain? Can the skies send showers on their own? No — only you can do this, LORD our God. So we put our hope in you, because you are the one who made all these things."
